title: NPR sues Trump, calls threat to pull federal funding unconstitutional
shortDescription: NPR filed a lawsuit on May 27 against the Trump administration over an executive order aimed at cutting the news outlet's federal funding.

title: Trump pardons ex-Virginia sheriff convicted in bribery scheme
shortDescription: Trump pardoned a former Virginia sheriff, Scott Jenkins, who was convicted of bribery, to protect him from serving a 10-year prison sentence.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump v. The King
shortDescription: King Charles III displays sovereignty as President Trump eyes Canada. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: Trump delivers Memorial Day speech
shortDescription: President Trump delivers speech at Arlington Cemetery for Memorial Day.

title: On Memorial Day, Trump honors 'ultimate sacrifice' and trumpets his wins
shortDescription: President Trump's remarks at Arlington National Cemetery contrasted with his more-combative public comments from throughout the long holiday weekend.

title: Charlie Rangel, longtime fixture in Congress, dies at 94
shortDescription: Former U.S. Rep. Charlie Rangel, who represented New York's Harlem neighborhood for nearly a half century, has died at the age of 94.

title: Charlie Rangel, longtime New York congressman, dies at 94
shortDescription: New York's Charlie Rangel served in Congress for nearly five decades and was the first Black chair of the powerful House Ways and Means Committee.

title: FBI to probe Biden White House cocaine incident, abortion opinion leak
shortDescription: Deputy FBI Director Dan Bongino announced the investigations on X into the 'cases of potential public corruption' that have large public interest.

title: Trump says Putin 'absolutely crazy'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says Vladimir Putin has gone 'absolutely crazy' after his attack on Ukraine.

title: Trump wants America to build tanks, not manufacture T-shirts and socks
shortDescription: China, with whom Trump has been locked in trade war for months, has been the world's largest apparel manufacturer and exporter for more than a decade.

title: Trump threatens to take $3 billion in US grants from Harvard
shortDescription: President Donald Trump suggested boosting trade schools, opening a new dimension of his administration's escalating fight with Harvard University.

title: Trump wishes 'HAPPY MEMORIAL DAY,' goes after opponents online
shortDescription: The president was active online to begin Memorial Day, a holiday meant to honor soldiers who have died while serving their country.

title: Trump to delay 50% EU tariffs
shortDescription: European stocks rose after President Donald Trump announced a delay in new 50% tariffs until July 9.

title: King Charles visiting Canada in support of country eyed by Trump
shortDescription: King Charles will open parliament in Ottawa, the first time a British monarch has done the duty since the late Queen Elizabeth did so 68 years ago.

title: 'Cracking heads': Trump, DOJ moves threaten George Floyd movement
shortDescription: Five years ago millions rallied for police reform after the deaths of Breonna Taylor and George Floyd. Trump is now exiting court-ordered settlements.

title: Texas House approves bill requiring Ten Commandments in public schools
shortDescription: The Republican-controlled House approved a version ofÂ Senate Bill 10, the latest effort to integrate religion into public education.

title: Trump says Putin has gone 'crazy' after Russian attack on Ukraine
shortDescription: Trump's comments come after Russia launched an attack, as drones and missiles targeted several cities across Ukraine, killing at least 12 people.

title: Trump extends 50% EU tariff deadline to July 9
shortDescription: Trump's announcement comes days after he threatened the EU with a 50% tariff after having paused reciprocal tariffs on it and other nations in April.

title: Trump tells graduates to avoid 'trophy wives' in West Point speech
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told graduating cadets to avoid "trophy wives" during a May 24 commencement speech at West Point.

title: Trump says he wants 'names and countries' of Harvard's international students
shortDescription: The president made the request in a social media post May 25, the latest in an ongoing battle between his administration and the Ivy League university.

title: 'Enough to stop the process': Republican senators slam Trump tax bill
shortDescription: The 1,000-plus-page legislation barely cleared the House. Now, it faces an unsure Senate chamber.
